abstract.p: Official All Star Cafe, five-year-old theme restaurant that helped to transform Times Square into a tourist destination, closes to make way for another theme restaurant owned by the same company; Planet Hollywood will move its flagship restaurant on 57th St near Seventh Ave to newly vacant space at 45th St and Broadway (S)

block.p: The Official All Star Cafe, a five-year-old theme restaurant that helped to transform Times Square into a tourist destination, closed Tuesday night to make way for another theme restaurant owned by the same company.
Planet Hollywood will move its flagship restaurant, on 57th Street near Seventh Avenue, to the newly vacant space at 45th Street and Broadway, company officials said.

Planet Hollywood will move its flagship restaurant, on 57th Street near Seventh Avenue, to the newly vacant space at 45th Street and Broadway, company officials said.
Planet Hollywood International, which owns both restaurants, has been closing unprofitable restaurants and franchising others since it filed for bankruptcy protection last October.
Company officials said the new Planet Hollywood would open this year.
